IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: RESPITE CARE, INC., IS A NON-PROFIT ORGANIZATION IN LARIMER COUNTY, COLORADO PROVIDING QUALITY SHORT TERM CARE FOR CHILDREN WITH DEVELOPMENTAL DISABILITIES AND RESPITE FOR THEIR FAMILIES TO ENHANCE THEIR QUALITY OF LIFE.
IRS990.MissionDesc: RESPITE CARE, INC., IS A NON-PROFIT ORGANIZATION IN LARIMER COUNTY, COLORADO PROVIDING QUALITY SHORT TERM CARE FOR CHILDREN WITH DEVELOPMENTAL DISABILITIES AND RESPITE FOR THEIR FAMILIES TO ENHANCE THEIR QUALITY OF LIFE.
IRS990.Desc: RESPITE CARE HAS PROVIDED MORE THAN 44,500 HOURS OF CARE THIS YEAR FOR CHILDREN WITH DEVELOPMENTAL DISABILITIES, SERVING MORE THAN 112 FAMILIES. WE PROVIDED TYPICAL DAY CARE ALONG WITH CRISIS, OVERNIGHT, AND VACATION CARE. WE ALSO PROVIDED ENHANCEMENT OPPORTUNITIES INCLUDING DAY CAMP, WILDERNESS CAMP, PROM FIELDTRIPS, AND CRAFT ACTIVITIES.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Part V, Line 4: Intended uses of the endowment fund.
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE PURPOSE OF THE ENDOWMENT FUND IS FUTURE SUSTAINABILITY OF THE ORGANIZATION.

The Organization is exempt from federal income taxes under Section 501(c)(3) of the Internal Revenue Code (IRC) and a similar provision of state law and has been classified as a public charity (not a private foundation) under Section 509(a)(2) of the IRC. However, the organization is subject to federal income tax on any unrelated business taxable income. During the years ended June 30, 2021 and 2020, the Organization did not incur any significant unrelated business income tax.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Part XII, Line 2d: Other expenses and losses per audited F/S
Form 990, Part VI, Line 11b: Form 990 Review Process
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: AUDITED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS ARE REVIEWED AND APPROVED BY THE FINANCE COMMITTEE AND THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS. THE FINANCE COMMITTEE REVIEWS AND APPROVES THE FORM 990 PRIOR TO FILING.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Line 12c: Explanation of Monitoring and Enforcement of Conflicts
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: AT THE BEGINNING OF EACH FISCAL YEAR, OFFICERS, DIRECTORS AND KEY EMPLOYEES ARE ASKED TO SIGN A STATEMENT REVEALING ANY POSSIBLE CONFLICTS OF INTEREST.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Line 15a: Compensation Review & Approval Process - CEO, Top Management
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE COLORADO NON PROFIT SALARY GUIDE IS USED WHEN DETERMINING SALARIES FOR THE EXECUTIVE DIRECTOR AND ADMINISTRATIVE STAFF. THE EXECUTIVE DIRECTOR IS REVIEWED ANNUALLY BY THE EXECUTIVE TEAM (BOARD OFFICERS) AND HER/HIS REIVEW AND SALARY ARE VOTED ON BY THE ENTIRE MEMBERSHIP OF THE BOARD. THE ADMINISTRATIVE STAFF PERFORMANCE AND SALARIES ARE REVIEWED ANNUALLY BY THE EXECUTIVE DIRECTOR.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Line 18: Explanation of Other Means Forms Available For Public Inspection
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: IN THE ANNUAL REPORT (WHICH IS DISTRUBUTED TO MAJOR DONORS), ON COLORADO GIVES PROFILE, AND MAILED TO ALL REQUESTING DONORS AND FUNDERS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Line 19: Other Organization Documents Publicly Available
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: NO DOCUMENTS AVAILABLE TO THE PUBLIC

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Other Changes In Net Assets Or Fund Balances - Other Increases

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: RETROACTIVELY FILED AMENDED 941-X FORMS DUE TO COVID RELATED RELIEF THROUGH THE EMPLOYEE RETENTION CREDITS. RETURN IS AMENDED TO REDUCE WAGES AND TO REPORT THE REFUND RECEIVABLE.
